# wadakatu - Backend Developer Portfolio

> Personal portfolio website for wadakatu, a backend developer based in Osaka, Japan. Currently working at Studio Inc. building no-code website builders. Active open source contributor to the Laravel ecosystem.

This is a static portfolio site showcasing my work, projects, and professional background as a backend developer specializing in PHP and Laravel.

## About Me

I am a backend developer with expertise in:
- PHP and Laravel framework
- API development and documentation
- Open source software contribution
- No-code/low-code platform development

Currently employed at Studio Inc. where I build no-code website builder tools.

Location: Osaka, Japan

## Featured Projects

- [Laravel Spectrum](https://docs.laravel-spectrum.dev): Zero-annotation API documentation generator for Laravel. Automatically generates OpenAPI documentation from your Laravel application without requiring annotations.
- [W3C Hackathon TPAC 2025](https://github.com/wadakatu/w3c-hackathon): Award-winning dashboard project built with vibe-coding methodology, guided by web standards. Winner at W3C TPAC 2025 hackathon.

## Social Links

- [GitHub](https://github.com/wadakatu): Open source contributions and personal projects
- [Zenn](https://zenn.dev/wadakatu): Technical articles and blog posts (Japanese)
- [X/Twitter](https://x.com/koyolympus): Professional updates and tech discussions

## Site Structure

- [Homepage](https://wadakatu.github.io/): Main portfolio page with navigation hub
- [Projects](https://wadakatu.github.io/projects): OSS contributions and personal works
- [Blog](https://wadakatu.github.io/blog): Technical articles and learnings
- [About](https://wadakatu.github.io/about): Career history and skills

## Technical Stack

This portfolio site is built with:
- Pure HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (no frameworks)
- Matrix-inspired dark theme design
- Responsive bento grid layout
- Full accessibility support (WCAG 2.2 compliant)
- Structured data (JSON-LD) for SEO and AI readability

## Contact

- Email: wadakatu.dev@gmail.com
- GitHub: @wadakatu
- X/Twitter: @koyolympus
